content: Unsolicited Written Offers of Credit and Insurance 33   Table 5.	 Opinions on helpfulness of  information in mail solicitations for  credit cards among surveyed  individuals and their handling of  such solicitations, 2004   Category Percent   Helpfulness of information  Very  Somewhat  Not very  Not at all  Do not know   Specific information cited as helpful1   Interest rate  Annual percentage rate  Introductory rate  Standard rate  Balance transfers or cash advances  Fixed versus variable  Any   Fees  Fees, not further specified  Annual or membership  Balance transfer or transaction  Late or penalty  Any   Other  Credit limits, payment policies,   grace periods  Benefits, rebates, rewards  Security, privacy   2 Other  Do not know   Handling of solicitations  Open and glance at them  Open and examine them  Throw them away without opening   Total   7.2  35.2  17.6  31.3   8.7   50.6  11.4  10.1   6.4  6.7   68.5   9.0  14.2   7.5  7.5   35.4   13.3   2.6  *   17.6   3.3   34.2  10.0  55.7   100   Note. Individuals who have general-purpose credit  cards and received solicitations.   1. Respondents could choose up to two items.  2. Includes “terms and conditions,” “pre-approval   qualifications,” and “services.”  * Less than 0.5 percent.  Source. University of Michigan Surveys of   Consumers, May 2004; sample is a nationally  representative selection of 500 respondents.
